Topic.Title: market goes up msft goes down, can't msft play the cronie capitalism card? but then Obama can't pick on Green Energy success

Message.Msg: I'd say it's not entirely reasonable to lay the responsibility all at Obama's feet; it's important to note that, at least for the last ten or fifteen years, many substantive issues making their way through both Congress and the Presidency - issues that impact populations far beyond minorities or special-interest groups - have received broad support among Democrats and Republicans alike. The repeal of Glass-Steagall, the Patriot Act, the NDAA, the de facto transfer of war powers to the President, and every budget deficit since the early 2000's (absent maybe a "controversial" 2% or so of the Federal budget, such as the $82 billion in cuts being debated right now), has gotten broad support from both major American parties. Despite their public declarations, when voting time comes our politicians are very often closely aligned regardless of party affiliation. Either Romney or McCain would have been different than Obama in small ways, but not in big ones.

Topic.Title: Gotta say I love my surface pro!

Message.Msg: if I think what you're thinking, than you are dead wrong. I am only overjoyed that the surface pro came out. I used to had an acer one netbook that I had to buy a touchscreen kit on ebay. After that one died, I was introduced the ipad. I was overjoyed with the ipad. But it had it's limitations being all locked up. I know the surface pro isn't for everybody, but for power user like me it is a blessing. I have been waiting for something like this motherFer to come around. I own an ipad so I know what is missing. I see an app get updated, so I go in and click update. Guess what? The developers put in ads! I can never revert back. And old softwares are given new life in this tablet form, too. Those are just a few of my complaints of ipads and android tablets. It will be fun to see how apple and google respond.

Topic.Title: Surface Pro 128 GB, 64 GB are top best sellers at Best Buy web

Message.Msg: Worst iFixit score ever A teardown of Microsoft’s new Surface Pro tablet has revealed that it is virtually impossible to repair. The tablet got the worst score handed out by iFixit, just one out of ten. It ranked lower than the iPad and Surface RT. The teardown revealed that the screen is held in place by “a metric duckload” of adhesive, which means it is almost impossible to remove. The battery is also glued in place and iFixit claims that it is impossible to replace without wrecking the back cover. As if a “duckload” of glue wasn’t enough, the Surface Pro also contains more than 90 screws. All this makes Microsoft’s new tablet impossible to repair and anyone trying to take it apart will probably destroy it in the process. Granted, tablets aren’t meant to be easily repairable, but the fact that it ranks lower than the iPad, which is notoriously tough to take apart and fix, doesn’t bode well for Redmond.

Topic.Title: Housing - Stock Markets - Economy - Employment THRIVING With Obama!!!

Message.Msg: Interviewed a person today whom was currently working and asked why he was to leave, and this was a fortune 1000 company. His response, they cut hours to 28 hrs a week the day they passed the affordable care act, and I simply can not live like this anymore, I just don't make enough money. How about this, do you want to know about the 700 applications and growing for a junior network position, I posted it last Thursday evening? Do you want to know how sadden I feel to see how many of these applicants are armed force veterans? Do you want me to tell you how many are middle aged people with 20 or more years experience in IT applying for an entry level job? Do you need to know that insurance premiums have increased over 30% a year in the past 3 years? How about this, my hometown the closed GM plant, no one has moved in, we did get a charlies sub shop and a new Taco Bell. What I can tell you is that this president is very bad for the economy and very good for large government. How many employees have to be hired to increase federal spending from 2.x trillion to 3.7 trillion a from 2007 to 2012 respectively. This president is awful, no leader.
